arm_group.description: Physician readers will interpret Amyvid scans using qualitative analysis followed by the use of quantitation. No subjects will be exposed to Florbetapir F 18 as part of this study.

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall objective of the study is to assess the feasibility of implementing a
      quantitative process of florbetapir F 18 scan interpretation. The hypothesis is that the use
      of quantitative analysis will increase the accuracy of florbetapir F 18 scan interpretation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Readers have undergone Amyvid reader training

          -  Readers have minimal experience with quantitation of amyloid PET scans

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Readers have previously been trained to quantitate amyloid PET scans

intervention.description: No Florbetapir F 18 will be administered in this study.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Evaluate whether the use of quantitation software improves the total accuracy of florbetapir F 18 scan interpretation. Total accuracy is defined as the number of scans correctly interpreted (vs. a truth standard) divided by the total number of scans read.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in reader accuracy after application of quantitation software

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate whether the use of quantitation software improves the reliability of florbetapir F 18 scan interpretation. The scan interpretation reliability will be evaluated using Fleiss' Kappa statistics.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in scan interpretation reliability after application of quantitation software

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
